titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Arch Cavenaugh & William Hacker, Indictment
CWG7380

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Owsly Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
Against } Indictment
Arch Cavenaugh & William Hacher

The Grand Jury of Owsly County in the name & by the authority of the Commonwelth of Kentucky accuses Archibald Cavennaugh & William Hacher of the offence of Robbery Commited as follows viz the said Archibald Cavennaugh & William Hacher did in the County aforesaid on the 3 day of Nov 1865 Feloniously & Forcibly and by puting Isaac N Cardwell in feer of some immediate injury to his person and aganst his will and Consent take from said Isaac N Cardwell One Mare of the value of $150 then property and in the possesion of said Isaac N Cardwell against the peace & dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

H F Finly Comlth atty
Witness
Isaac N Cardwell
Filed 4 Nov 1865.
A Copy attest
A B McGuire C o C C
